intro: Austrostipa eremophila, commonly known as the Emu Bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions. Austrostipa eremophila plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for native fauna in its native range.
